header: Cri. Bail Appl. No. 45/2019 ( CNR No. : MHPU01­000197­2019 ) Amol Nighojkar Vs. State of Maharashtra

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 1] This is an application by Amol Ramakant Nighojkar for regular bail under Section 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No.202/2018 registered under Sections 376, 506 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Ranjangaon MIDC, Pune Rural.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 439 of code of criminal procedure
under sections 376, 506 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 2] The crime has been registered on report of victim lady of 35 years who is a married lady. She alleged that, prior to seven months, she got acquainted with Applicant at village Karegaon, Tal. Shirur. That time, Applicant took her mobile number and used to call her and used to assure her for marriage. At that time, on one day, when she was alone in the house of her Aunt, Applicant established physical relations with her by giving assurance of marriage. Thereafter, also Applicant committed sexual intercourse with her at Baburao Nagar, Shirur, Dist.Pune. However, on 15/11/2018, Applicant denied for marriage and threatened. Therefore, she lodged the report.

argumentSentences.text: 2] The crime has been registered on report of victim lady of 35 years who is a married lady.
She alleged that, prior to seven months, she got acquainted with Applicant at village Karegaon, Tal.
Shirur.
That time, Applicant took her mobile number and used to call her and used to assure her for marriage.
At that time, on one day, when she was alone in the house of her Aunt, Applicant established physical relations with her by giving assurance of marriage.
Thereafter, also Applicant committed sexual intercourse with her at Baburao Nagar, Shirur, Dist.Pune.
However, on 15/11/2018, Applicant denied for marriage and threatened.
Therefore, she lodged the report.

arguments.text: 3] Applicant submits that, police arrested him on 16/11/2018. Since then he is behind the bars. Investigation is over. Further, Informant is married lady of 35 years, having sufficient level of understanding. Still she maintained relations with Applicant. Therefore, the relations were absolutely consensual. No offence of rape would attract in this matter. Applicant submits that, his further custody is not necessary. Therefore, he may be released on bail.

argumentSentences.text: 3] Applicant submits that, police arrested him on 16/11/2018.
Since then he is behind the bars.
Investigation is over.
Further, Informant is married lady of 35 years, having sufficient level of understanding.
Still she maintained relations with Applicant.
Therefore, the relations were absolutely consensual.
No offence of rape would attract in this matter.
Applicant submits that, his further custody is not necessary.
Therefore, he may be released on bail.

arguments.text: 4] Learned APP Mr. Satpute appeared for Respondent/State and filed report of investigation officer. He submits that, offence is serious in nature. There are chances of tampering. Hence, the application may be rejected.

argumentSentences.text: 4] Learned APP Mr. Satpute appeared for Respondent/State and filed report of investigation officer.
He submits that, offence is serious in nature.
There are chances of tampering.
Hence, the application may be rejected.

arguments.text: 5] Heard the learned Adv. S. D Swami for Applicant and the learned APP Mr. Satpute for Respondent/State. Perused the Papers.

argumentSentences.text: 5] Heard the learned Adv. S. D Swami for Applicant and the learned APP Mr. Satpute for Respondent/State.
Perused the Papers.

arguments.text: 6] Prima facie, the Informant is major and married lady, having sufficient level of understanding. She is well aware about the consequences of her act. Still she did not file report against Applicant at the earliest. Further, I perused the medical examination report of Informant, her genital and private parts are shown to be normal. There is no evidence of any injury on person of Informant. Therefore, prima facie possibility of consensual relations between Applicant and Informant cannot be ruled out. Investigation with the Applicant is over. Therefore, further detention of the Applicant will serve no purpose. By putting necessary conditions on Applicant, the necessary care can be taken. Hence, I prefer to pass following Order.

argumentSentences.text: 6] Prima facie, the Informant is major and married lady, having sufficient level of understanding.
She is well aware about the consequences of her act.
Still she did not file report against Applicant at the earliest.
Further, I perused the medical examination report of Informant, her genital and private parts are shown to be normal.
There is no evidence of any injury on person of Informant.
Therefore, prima facie possibility of consensual relations between Applicant and Informant cannot be ruled out.
Investigation with the Applicant is over.
Therefore, further detention of the Applicant will serve no purpose.
By putting necessary conditions on Applicant, the necessary care can be taken.
Hence, I prefer to pass following Order.

order.text: ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The Applicant, namely, Amol Ramakant Noghojkar be released on bail on executing P.R. bond of Rs. 25,000/­ (Rupees Twenty Five Thousand Only) with one or more solvent sureties of the like amount in Crime No. 202/2018 registered under Sections 376, 506 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Ranjangaon MIDC, Pune Rural on the following terms and conditions. [i] Applicant to co­operate investigation machinery fully. [ii] Applicant should not contact Informant and witnesses and should not tamper the evidence in the matter. [iii] Applicant should not enter into area of Informant for further period of three months. [iv] Applicant to provide proof of his permanent address and contact details to the concern investigation officer. [v] Applicant should not indulge into any crime. [vi] Applicant should not change his address and contact details without prior intimation to investigation officer and the concern Court. 3] Bail before the concern Court of Magistrate. 4] Intimate to the concern Police Station accordingly.

processedText:
Cri. Bail Appl. No. 45/2019 ( CNR No. : MHPU01­000197­2019 ) Amol Nighojkar Vs. State of Maharashtra 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 1] This is an application by Amol Ramakant Nighojkar for regular bail under Section 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No.202/2018 registered under Sections 376, 506 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Ranjangaon MIDC, Pune Rural. 
---background-ends---
2] The crime has been registered on report of victim lady of 35 years who is a married lady. She alleged that, prior to seven months, she got acquainted with Applicant at village Karegaon, Tal. Shirur. That time, Applicant took her mobile number and used to call her and used to assure her for marriage. At that time, on one day, when she was alone in the house of her Aunt, Applicant established physical relations with her by giving assurance of marriage. Thereafter, also Applicant committed sexual intercourse with her at Baburao Nagar, Shirur, Dist.Pune. However, on 15/11/2018, Applicant denied for marriage and threatened. Therefore, she lodged the report. 
---argument-ends---
3] Applicant submits that, police arrested him on 16/11/2018. Since then he is behind the bars. Investigation is over. Further, Informant is married lady of 35 years, having sufficient level of understanding. Still she maintained relations with Applicant. Therefore, the relations were absolutely consensual. No offence of rape would attract in this matter. Applicant submits that, his further custody is not necessary. Therefore, he may be released on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4] Learned APP Mr. Satpute appeared for Respondent/State and filed report of investigation officer. He submits that, offence is serious in nature. There are chances of tampering. Hence, the application may be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
5] Heard the learned Adv. S. D Swami for Applicant and the learned APP Mr. Satpute for Respondent/State. Perused the Papers. 
---argument-ends---
6] Prima facie, the Informant is major and married lady, having sufficient level of understanding. She is well aware about the consequences of her act. Still she did not file report against Applicant at the earliest. Further, I perused the medical examination report of Informant, her genital and private parts are shown to be normal. There is no evidence of any injury on person of Informant. Therefore, prima facie possibility of consensual relations between Applicant and Informant cannot be ruled out. Investigation with the Applicant is over. Therefore, further detention of the Applicant will serve no purpose. By putting necessary conditions on Applicant, the necessary care can be taken. Hence, I prefer to pass following Order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The Applicant, namely, Amol Ramakant Noghojkar be released on bail on executing P.R. bond of Rs. 25,000/­ (Rupees Twenty Five Thousand Only) with one or more solvent sureties of the like amount in Crime No. 202/2018 registered under Sections 376, 506 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Ranjangaon MIDC, Pune Rural on the following terms and conditions. [i] Applicant to co­operate investigation machinery fully. [ii] Applicant should not contact Informant and witnesses and should not tamper the evidence in the matter. [iii] Applicant should not enter into area of Informant for further period of three months. [iv] Applicant to provide proof of his permanent address and contact details to the concern investigation officer. [v] Applicant should not indulge into any crime. [vi] Applicant should not change his address and contact details without prior intimation to investigation officer and the concern Court. 3] Bail before the concern Court of Magistrate. 4] Intimate to the concern Police Station accordingly. 
---order-ends---
